books.name: Norwegian Wood
books.author: Haruki Murakami
books.review: The most famous book by Murakami, it masterfully tackles all the aspects of human relationships, feels extremely real

books.name: The Maltese Falcon
books.author: Dashiel Hammett
books.review: Standard for book noir, the main protagonist is as hard boiled as it gets

books.name: The Hunt for Red October
books.author: Tom Clancy
books.review: This book is so phenomenal and the research writing is so extensive that Tom Clancy was thought to be briefed by The White House!

books.name: Splinter Cell
books.author: Tom Clancy
books.review: A very entertaining stealth thrill ride

books.name: Call of the Wild
books.author: Jack London
books.review: Adventure tale about survival in the wilderness

books.name: After Dark
books.author: Haruki Murakami
books.review: A hypnotic and dreamy novel with a cinematic vision

books.name: Prometheus Bound
books.author: Aeschylus
books.review: This book is really powerful and relevant in modern times

books.name: Antigone
books.author: Sophocles
books.review: A really powerful book about love and heroism

books.name: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
books.author: Phillip K. Dick

books.name: The Abbess of Castro
books.author: Stendhal
books.review: A deeply moving tale about heroism and honor

books.name: The Plains
books.author: Gerald Murnane
books.review: This book feels more like something you've seen painted rather than something you've read

books.name: The Prince
books.author: Niccolo Macchiavelli
books.review: Extremely powerful novel about deploying various tactics to win
